reviews.text: Okay, this is another MUST while in the LA area. The hike is quite a hike. Bring water, good shoes and a camera with enough space. A lot of the roads are for private homes so just be mindful of where you go. The view is great. Breathtaking !

We walked and hiked the 4 1/2 miles (total) to see the Hollywood sign. Totally worth the breath taking view. Especially on a beautiful, clear LA day. It’s truly a hike. You’ll get a good workout. It’s not for the unfit individual. But you’ll see a lot along the way. Do it! So many photo opportunities along the way.

The city of angels - the hollywood sign - Los Angeles must seen! Incredible view over the entire city of Los Angeles including Santa Monica. The view is literally breathtaking. The hike up the hill will take you around 1 hour by feet. There are a lot of people to chat with and walk together. Bring your own water due the dry heat and probably think about wearing a hat :-) Enjoy!

I looked at this little bit and while it was cool to see it in person, dang did it taste bad. Won’t be licking this dumb sign ever again. 
Also where did the LAND bit go?

Great hike for a good workout. Steep in the beginning, you get a nice break in the middle, then it gets steep again as you start the last mile or so towards the peak of Mt. Lee. Start EARLY no later than 730 if you want to avoid crowds. It gets EXTREMELY crowded.

Capitol Records is an iconic part of Hollywood, California. I love the label. It’s where I dropped off my first demo. Always fun to visit. One of my favorite spots. Now, all I need is a good roommate.

Capitol Records building is a great place to visit especially if you get the VIP tour where you get to see the recording studios down below the gift shop is unbelievable it's a must-see. It used to be one of the tallest buildings but it's now a miniature compared to the new Landmark surrounded.
My name is George Anton I am a famous film director in Hollywood here and I do business with capital records five stars to this building
Its a very interesting place to be next to but we did not go in we were across the street. It is very beautiful though. There is a great taco truck across the street. Uts delicious!
Cool landmark building.  Home of Capital records. What a cool place for an office eh,

Amazing behind the scene looks and how movies are made! Although it was a great experience, at the moment I thought I will lose and interest and excitement of all the movies that I'm going to watch in the future as I now  know how everything was made to look like it looks on the screen. After this experience, movies will never be the same for me!

One of my favorite studios of all time. I work here so here are some hints. If you buy a tour tickets to Paramount Studios, my suggestion is go during the middle of the day between 11am and 3pm. That's where most of the things are happening (building, shooting, action, movie stars and all that). You are more than likely to spot a few actors and actresses. They will drive you in a Limo golf cart throughout the studios and give you the current info on shows and movies as well as history here. At some occasions they even walk you into a stage to see how things really happen in Hollywood. But regardless what day or time you go, you will always find something interesting and be amazed but everything there is to see. Enjoy!!!

A must do activity when you’re in LA. If you love golf carts, you’ll be happy since most of the tour is being driven around, always fun!

It was a fun tour, and very informative. Would have liked to see some live sets and celebrities, but it was still a fun visit!

Love how you get to keep your name pass at the end as a souvenir.

Mythic place, a great moment to revisit cult movies. The visit was very instructive and the guide was passionate about it. We got to discover how some special effects are made as well. Overall great experience.

I went here as an afterthought, the day after doing the Warner Brothers tour. So I had something to compare with. It seems to me that Paramount has little consideration for the visiting public. They set up 2 tiny rooms to wait in that have some costumes and props, and a short promotional film. The "page" was professional, and I don't fault him for my low opinion. Once on the tour, there is not much to see that you can't see from the street. The history lesson was appropriate, but again, not much to see as he was showing movie clips on his iPad. There appeared to be just one street set, which was in use filming (which was kinda cool). We stopped at a prop room that was quite small but did have some Star Trek props, which I appreciated. And we walked on to the set of Face the Truth. A bit disappointing after I had just the previous day walked on the set of Ellen and Big Bang Theory. The gift shop was tiny and had little more than Paramount paraphernalia. That was about it.

This is like going to a country club movie theater. You pay a lot to get in, but concession prices are respectable. The screens and sound are both top notch. Everything seemed clean. Maybe not worth it every time, but definitely nice every now and again.

Always such a warm and welcoming experience. The restaurant is perfect and pretty well priced. I also loved that the restaurant took note of your movie time. We saw Captain Marvel in the dome where all seats are great! And we got to see the directors of the movie in person!

This is a great place to watch movies and my favorite movie theater in Hollywood area.  If you happen to watch the movie in the actual dome, this is historic building. They will have curtains closed and then open when movie starts and someone will come an annonce the movie in person. Very interesting!

The Arclight Hollywood is such a great place. No teenagers jumping on seats or people throwing trash everywhere. It is a classy place to see a movie. Pricey but worth it. Parking is convenient and good eateries are nearby. My favorite place to see a movie.

It’s a great theater and the night staff is actually very kind and welcoming! My only actual complaint is the fact that the popcorn kinda makes me sick for some reason but I guess that’s on me I gotta stop eating the stuff but I love popcorn so I can’t help it! I actually think it’s the butter so if you have a weak stomach I suggest not eating the popcorn with butter!

Had a quick tour around this theatre. Very nice decor inside and out. It was sad knowing that some of the original architecture did not survive as it would be epic to see. The design is funky but as a cinema I feel like you would be sitting down and looking up to a screen ...maybe it's different in the states compared to the UK as I am sure i.would get a sore neck watching a film looking up for a long time.
A beautiful and historic venue that I had a great opportunity to finally visit and see an opening of a great indie film.  Can't wait to go back and see something else there.

I did the guided docent tour with Mark and it was an incredible experience. We toured every part of the facility from the courtyard to the projection room and learnt a lot about the history of the theatre a d the incredible Sid Graumann. Highly recommend for everyone and especially movie buffs.
Nice old restored theater, but the odd acoustics cause the volunteers to make weird shushing chants.

Always the best classic and cult films playing, with some dose of new independent and foreign films to make this the best revival house in L.A.! (Sorry, Tarantino) 
Check their online schedule and you'll see what I'm sayin'!

Really cool place to pass by. Just be mindful that it’s always packed around here. It’s a landmark and a must see tourist attraction. The structure is amazing and it’s cool to actually see in person. Definitely a must if it’s your first time in LA. It’s part of one of the touristy things you must do!

Really friendly staff. Love going in and feeling like a movie star in Hollywood. Theatre was clean. Movie theater screen was high quality with excellent sound. Saw Apollo 11 and was really engulfed in the experience. Definitely would go again

Historical and sacred theater. Lady a few seats over put her nasty bare feet on the seat in front of her, no respect or class. Great theater, the seats are newer and tilt back great. Imax worth it. Get validated at the info office!

The theater isn't as grand on the outside as you imagine it because the city has crowded it in. Still amazing, but a shame. 

Take the tour before browsing around outside, it was $14 for an adult. The guides are super and have a great wealth of knowledge. The props are few but interesting. They are not properly cared for or protected enough in my opinion, which is truly a shame.

The theater is really something to behold. Words cannot describe it. After the tour, spend time fitting your feet and hands outside. Lots of fun.

Come back to view a movie in the main theater. Doesn't matter what it is, you'll never forget it. You also get a free bag of popcorn with your tour receipt.

They have a small bar with drinks too.

While it certainly is a tourist destination, there is such a thrill to be in the courtyard of the Chinese Theatre. Seeing all the footprints of the stars of yesteryear and today is so much fun. We had a great time! Wonderful place- tourist place, but really a must see if your a movie buff. Take the tour, it’s worth it! Will do again when we aren’t on a heavy schedule. We enjoyed walking around, stepping in the footprints and placing our hands in the handprints. It was crowded but everyone took turns taking photos.
Fun place but not very big ...
What a fun time looking into the history very nice presentation.
There is a lot of cool and interesting Hollywood history here.

"Since 1985, Hollywood Heritage has funded the preservation, restoration and maintenance of early Hollywood treasures. The museum features archival photographs from the silentera of motion pictures, movie props, historic documents and other movie related memorabilia. Also featured are historic photographs and postcards of the streets, buildings and residences of Hollywood during its golden age. Special events entitled 'Evenings at the Barn' are open to the public and regularly programmed including speakers, screenings and/or slideshows with a focus toward Hollywood's early history. Occasionally, historic silent films are screened in cooperation with the Silent Society."
Great place to visit if you are a movie buff of the golden hollywood era!

Absolutely a fun time!!! Definitely check out this attraction! The employees are so helpful, polite and entertaining!! I chose the package deal and it was definitely worth the money and time I absolutely enjoyed myself!!! Thanks again Curtis you definitely made the evening entertaining. Go visit this attraction and enjoy!

This is the first "wax museum" I've gone to, as I've always thought of them as kind of tacky.  BUT, I was pleasantly surprised!  This was done very well, with some really good figures.  The rules are "don't touch the hands or the face", but they have multiple places you can dress or hold props, or be part of the "scene" being depicted for photos, so that makes it more fun.  They've got a good mix of new and old, male and female...and alien...and horror characters and monsters, etc. Speaking of, the one thing I'd recommend is a way to bypass entirely the "horror movie" figures.  I'm sure I'm not alone in this - I have a daughter that's old enough that she knows many of the figures, but still young enough that they really scare her.  After some prodding and pushing, I got her to hold my hand, stare at the stairs and floor and run through the "dungeon scene".   That being said, I don't know if that would even be possible, but the only other option would be to go back out the way we came, and then see if they'd let us go backward into the end of the museum.  There may not be any way to arrange it differently. Overall, it was a fun experience, and the "combo ticket" which includes the "Castle of Chaos" (interactive 4d movie/ride thing), the mini-golf, and the mirror maze, was well worth the cost of admission.

Been here a lot. Best place ever! I love this place. Best place in Branson. I really hope this stays forever. It’s cool, fun and takes up at least an hour-2. Plus guess what they have this amazing 4-D experience there is no way to describe it you just have to go!!!

We had so much fun here! The price included the wax museum, an interactive game, put put and a mirror maze. I would def recommend for families and couples alike! You can do the wax museum by itself but it only costs a few bucks extra to do all the other stuff I mentioned... definitely worth it. Oh and it’s interactive with the wax figures so you can take pictures and dress up with props! Super fun.

Family and I loved this place. The wax models were so realistic. They have props to make photographs more enjoyable. We took lots of pictures. Nothing was rushed and the staff were so friendly. I recommend this to everyone.

Great place for family fun. Good to go if it's night or raining out to bring the family. The wax figures look incredibly realistic, almost scary! Great place for kids as well, the props are a great touch and it's nice to be able to walk around and interact with the wax figures. Would bring others there for sure.

Fun place to visit while in LA, especially when the weather isn't great or after the sun goes down. Fun for all ages, great for a family activity - I loved the props at several of the wax figures and opportunities to engage and have fun; not your typical museum, for sure. 3 levels and dozens of wax figures as well as a section detailing the process. Staff was friendly and left us alone to explore, which was great. It was expensive - check out late afternoon discounts.
Couldn't believe how extensive it was. I enjoyed it very much, and you can always catch a good deal on the way with flyers handed out. Would recommend to anyone visiting Los Angeles.

Madame Tussaud’s wax museum in Hollywood is a great example of the work started in France all those years ago. Each status is a carefully crafted work of art, that takes around 500 hours of dedicated work, and it shows. Very beautiful pieces, and an entirely worth-it experience.

Well worth a visit and if you are clever get yourself a 50% voucher which they hand out down Hollywood Boulevard. The waxworks are based over several floors working your way from top to bottom. Loads of celebrities on display. One thing we did like was the props at various exhibits to dress up and add to your photos.

I really enjoyed this museum, it has a wide range of topics regarding death and murder and there are lots of hidden gems. Very serial killer focused. Give yourself at least an hour to check everything out, and leave time for their awesome gift shop. Parking is limited in the area, there is some paid parking on the street but plenty of free street parking on the off streets as well.

Very interesting and well researched material. Some images are disturbing but everything was overall well put together. It's definitely worth a visit if you are interested in the various kinds of Death.

This place had an awesome display for so many different death themes: serial killers, embalming/funerals, mass cult suicides, etc. Some very graphic photos and interesting historical items are strewn throughout the museum. Staff was very friendly and informative. Definitely worth the visit. Plus, a student ID gets your whole group a discount.

This was a very impressive place. We weren’t completely sure what to expect. But, it was interesting and definitely worth the 1.5 mile walk to get here, from our hotel. The room dedicated to Charles Manson was particularly interesting.

This was such a fun experience. If you’re in LA and want something a little different to do, definitely give it a try. The tickets are cheap and the exhibit is very well done. There are also photos that you can’t see anywhere else. Maybe not for the faint of heart, for there are some disturbing images (which should be expected from a museum about death)

This was my first time I had eaten at in and Out Burger. I absolutely loved it however I'm trying to eat better and every time I drive by one of these I have to stop now. So there goes my eating better right out the window. Happy face covered in ketchup. The staff was great in fact they were really funny which was fun in the food of course it's in and out burger is great

Our favorite place to eat! The fries are the best! The employees are always friendly. The burgers are by far the best in all of California. I come here way too often. Its conveniently located close to school so I don’t have to travel a long ways!

Was disappointed with my visit to in-n-out tonight. Food was cold and the taste wasn't up to standards. The staff were incredible and they all greeted me with a smile but, the food was off. I do have to say the Milk shake was delicious. However, both the double double and the fries were served cold and the burger was under cooked. Never received an under cooked burger from In-n-out, so I am sure my next visit will be better hopefully.

What can I say?  In n Out is always great.  The line was out the door for eat in, and out the driveway and into the street for drive through.  It was 2:30 pm on Saturday.  I had a complicated order, which they got right.  The 40-minute wait made me grumpy, that's why just four stars.
Friendly people, delicious food and for the most part fast. If it was not such a long line I would've given it 5 stars! I will be coming back here if I'm in the area

Enjoyable, flavorful, fresh. The squid was perfect. The citrus sauce with spice, peanuts and cilantro was so good I was finding other food vehicles to intake more of the sauce! The noodles and veggies were also very good. I wish there were more gluten free options for my family member who is severely gluten intolerant. I would like to try the curries and the cocktails next time. The themes of the cocktails seem very creative. Our server was so friendly and informative. The hostess was not very welcoming unfortunately.
I like this place.  Satisfying Thai cuisine and large but not cold environment, room area wise.  It's pleasant.  Staff is nice and efficient. Coconut shrimp soup is tasty.

This is my new favorite restaurant to stop at when I visit L.A.    the portions are huge and everything I have tried is delicious! They have live bands there and it's not too loud.  Parking is $4 for valet.

I stumbled upon this restaurant while walking near Pikes Place and it was a good find. It was NYE so they did not offer their lunch menu which was a bit disappointing but the Pad Thai was delicious! It was super flavorful and not dry which some pad thai can be, not to mention the presentation was lovely. All of the dishes we ordered came plated very creatively which I enjoyed. The prices are moderately priced with dinner dishes ranging from $15-$24 roughly. Overall it was a good spot and I would return.

Pretty good food and they deliver! I'm sold!  I ordered food at 5 and was done eating by 5:45 it was so good. We got the pad Thai, yellow curry and glass noodle soup.  Everything was yummy.  The delivery guy was nice and boy were they fast.  I'm totally ordering from here again.

GREAT PLACE FOR A ROMANTIC DINNER!
We didn't know what to expect as our son arranged it all for our anniversary, so we just went along with an open mind and good attitude. 
We enjoyed a very nice evening with great service, interesting and tasty food selection and to top it all, we were able to carry on a nice conversation without a need to yell in order to hear each other. 
All food and drink selections came in a nice presentation, good quality and taste. Everything was reasonably priced and for the first in a long time, we were able to enjoy a romantics evening with dinner, good drinks and rich and pleasant conversation. We Will definitely go back

This Hollywood hot spot is the perfect place to spot a Hollywood actor, producer or executive. The lunch specials at Ammo make this a great location for a working lunch. The booths seats are just secluded enough to give you some privacy from the other patrons. I recommend the orecchiette pesto pasta. You can also easily find a meter parking if you don't want to use valet.

As a vegetarian, it is a painful thing to be sitting in an expensive restaurant in LA and be offered a plate of steamed vegetables or bland pasta for $30 -- especially as your companions get served gorgeous dishes. Ammo offers a great deal of variety (more than one option!) for vegetarians, and they understand that vegetarian doesn't have to mean bland or boring.

Menu options rotate frequently, and ingredients are always superb.

Service is always great -- friendly but not pushy, and the right balance of paying attention but leaving you alone with friends.

Decor is simple, but very comfortable, and easy to sit for hours chatting. Small bar is cozy unless things get crowded. Wine and liquor are options are very good.

great atmosphere and great hype with ok food. not bad but considering how many times i've heard the name, i expected better brunch fairs. maybe their dinner is the way to go? but i always judge a creative restaurant by their brunch since i think it's hard
quiety, but hip vibe, good healthy   comfort food.  lunch scene lends   itself to film industry types.

The food is always delicious and the servings are so large you can easily split some orders between 3 people. Parking isn't bad for Hollywood, either. The only downside is the wait, which there will be no matter what time you come by. The inside is cozy and the atmosphere is very casual. Definitely worth dropping bu if you're in the area.

Best French Toast (moms).... The Griddle has a great  atmosphere with a unique menu that has you want to go back over and over, because your tastes buds are craving the great food. A long with the great food you will receive great helpfully friendly service. You will wait a while but so worth it. Highly recommend this place. Add to your bucket list.

Excellent food for what it is, plus fast and friendly service. The pancakes are as advertised: delicious AND huge. I loved the potato skin Benedict. Be prepared to wait but they have an efficient process. Recommended.

Today my blue berry pancake hunt took me to The Griddle. This place is very popular and you have to wait in line to get a table from when they open. The potions are over the top! I severing is like a full birthday cake in size. Its impossible to eat it all. Great coffee and good service. If you go - share your meal!

Amazing little breakfast spot that was recommending to us by our Uber driver. Good food, big portions and you even get a French press for your coffee order.  When ordering pancakes make sure you are hungry!  Pancakes are the size of your plate and come in single, double and triple stacks. Recommend visitors to this area check it out

For a fine dining experience, you MUST visit.  This is old-school Hollywood at its best.  The service is impeccable and the food is always fresh and delicious, with plenty of options.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting.  Just go and experience it for yourself!

I lived in Los Angeles in the 80s and 90s and wanted to eat here but never did. Finally, all these years later, I'm visiting LA with my wife and made the decision to give it a try.   Good decision! We were treated to a true piece of Old Hollywood...  Like going back in time.  The meal was delicious, the staff were friendly and attentive and the drinks were perfectly crafted.  I had the filet and a cosmopolitan and my wife had the salmon and a gin gimlet.   I highly recommend Musso & Frank ...

Very disappointing. Was excited to finally experience this 100 year old institution but man, what a let down. The famous martini comes in a tiny glass with a small ice chilled carafe for refills, unique but ultimately, just another martini. My steak, ordered medium came out with just a hint of pink in the middle, the rest was gray and dry. The onion rings were overly breaded, overwhelming the onion. Au gratin potatoes were good as was the creamed spinach. Oh and of course the waiter was nowhere to be found when we needed the check. There you go, my first and last visit.

A truly wonderful dining experience .roast lamb with mint jelly and baked potato.... lobster bisque.... Devine! And mussels sauteed in olive oil and garlic with truffle fries in the center..... heaven

Fantastic historical Hollywood restaurant  (100 years old this year) in the heart of Hollywood on Hollywood Blvd  (valet parking in rear). My family highly recommends this food establishment. Great food and wonderful service.

Amazing, hole in the wall sushi spot! Grab a seat at the counter and make sure to order at least one roll off the Fresh from Japan menu on the white board above the chefs. I got the Tahoe roll (with fresh tuna) and Pokémon roll, both phenomenal!! Rolls have 6 generous sized pieces of sushi. Vegetable/shrimp tempura app had the perfect, light crunch. Don't miss out!

Great atmosphere. Ate in the garden area which is beautiful. They have lots of heaters so you stay warm. Food wonderful tho they have raised their prices. Good for a special occasion. Free birthday dessert!

It's not the same as before.... miss the salt plate for one. Is the food good? yes. Are there amazing views? if you're outside (or if you walk around and it's not blocked off from a private party like the last time we went). Service?  Not this time, delayed seating, didn't have enough of the 'new' menu and not so much personal attention. The pricing.... well it's in line for where you are and what you're ordering.  I've only been here a couple times, but hope this recent experience was a fluke and not indicative of a new direction, but is what reflects what would normally be a higher rating.

I've been to this restaurant and their sister restaurant on Polk. Both places are really nice! I love the dark, dim-lighted aesthetic that's perfect for date nights and just a nice dinner with friends. Their oysters and sashimi are very fresh! They taste super good! They have specials occurring everyday. Food did take a little while but overall food is really good and fresh.

This place's been always considered as one of top 5 places in LA with great city views. Inside of the restaurant, it has kind of mix of tradtional and modern vibe. Food is great with a wide range of prices for sure. The Japanese garden feels exotic and its surrounding view is spectacular and great! Highly recommended!
Worst frozen yougert I have ever had.   Also there was a hair in my cup!  The seller is not familiar with what he was selling.
